items.title: Senior AWS Redshift Engineer at Clevertech () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Senior AWS Redshift Engineer to join our global team. We are looking for team members to help us develop world class software products for the most exclusive organizations in the world. We have been at this since 2000, and continue to grow off our best asset, our people.

You are comfortable translating functional and technical requirements into detailed architecture and design in addition to overall system architecture, scalability, reliability, and performance. You are highly experienced with large-scale data analytics and data warehousing. You are able to devise proactive solutions to project-related issues and have stellar communication skills to be able to effectively communicate and inspire trust in all stakeholders.

We will only consider candidates who have worked with petabytes of data in Redshift.

REQUIREMENTS

Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code. You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like-minded individuals.

Technically, you have an excellent background with large-scale data structures, highly scalable server architectures and experience with network load balancers and network security. Familiarity with large-scale distributed server infrastructure design and development is essential in addition to being comfortable with industry best practices.

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz.

Benefits

Full-Time Telecommuting
Flexible Schedules
Paid Time Off
Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
Contribute to Open Source

items.title: PHP MVC (Laravel, CakePHP) / MySQL developer at Vimbly - NYC (New York, NY) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Recreation & Leisure, Software Development / Engineering, Web Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Why join Vimbly?

Vimbly Technologies is a funded and profitable web 2.0 startup looking for a highly motivated, hard-hitting PHP developer to join the team.  Vimbly Technologies is a fast-paced company focused on creating custom best-in-class, high-performance solutions for enterprises spanning a variety of industries.  At Vimbly, youâ€™ll work side-by-side with proven talent, creative intelligence, and smiley faces (with firm but non-painful handshakes) -- out of our office in the best city in the world, right across from the Empire State Building. Your work will have a direct and meaningful impact on the product. We aren't looking for another cog in the wheel. You will be given significant responsibility and independence. You will be challenged.

PHP MVC Developer

We are looking for a PHP MVC developer with a burning curiosity, passion for building great products, track record of writing maintainable code, and reputation of being reliable and efficient.  Our preferred MVC frameworks are Laravel and CakePHP.

Candidates able to join our team on-site in our office in Midtown Manhattan are highly preferred, but consideration for remote work will be given to exceptional candidates.  Please indicate your location on your application; applications without a location will be ignored.

Responsibilities

  • Work directly with leadership on implementing cutting-edge company initiatives
  • Develop scalable and robust back-end systems (e.g., payment, analytics, scheduling)
  • Work with front-end team to integrate user-facing markup into systems
  • Take ownership of multiple projects and learn new technologies over time

Benefits

  • 100% employer-covered health, dental & vision insurance
  • Unlimited vacation days (just get your work done)
  • Activity budget to try items on Vimbly -- try one, try them all!
  • Personal movie outings (you'll get more pairs of movie tickets than you're able to use -- so you'll know the contrast from a Vimbly activity!)
  • Unlimited Amazon reading budget to buy any book you please
  • Monthly social outings (Laser tag and paintball? Coming right up...)
  • Monthly massage and optional monthly manicureâ€¦ except they come to you

Requirements

  • Expert-level experience with PHP and MySQL
  • Strong experience working with MVC paradigm
  • Understanding of front-end development and implementation (HTML5, CSS3, and jQuery)
  • Knowledge of Git version control
  • Exemplary attention to detail
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or equivalent

Bonus Points

  • Laravel or CakePHP
  • SASS
  • Composer
  • Track record with microservices and multi-server architectures
  • System administration in Linux and Apache
  • nginx
  • Experience with process efficiency optimization

About Vimbly - NYC

Founded in 2011, Vimbly is a funded web 2.0 startup that lets users find and book recreational activities for free. Our mission is to eliminate hours of research for thousands of activities like tango lessons, intro photography classes, or Italian cooking sessions. All the information is in one place instead of the usual process of Googling, picking nearby locations, checking prices, manually comparing schedules (which are each presented differently), and then exchanging emails to lock it down.

The Vimbly team is a diverse, smart and energetic group of problem solvers.  We are each experts in our specific trade, unified by a passion to build a great product that will change the way people discover activities, date ideas, things to do, and life experiences.

Benefits

Health / dental / vision insurance
Activity budget to try items on Vimbly
Unlimited vacation days (just get your work done)
Monthly massage and optional monthly manicure... and they come to you
Monthly social outings (laser tag and paintball? Coming right up...)

items.title: HealthPrize | Software Dev | Norwalk, CT | REMOTE Full-time | https://www.healthprize.com/ | $110k-150k + equity At HealthPrize, we are changing the way ...
items.content:
HealthPrize | Software Dev | Norwalk, CT | REMOTE Full-time | https://www.healthprize.com/ | $110k-150k + equity

At HealthPrize, we are changing the way people think about their medication and their health! Our growth is being fueled by work with leading brands in life sciences such as Abbott, Walgreens, and Gilead. Join the close-knit engineering team that designs & develops our industry leading patient engagement platform and work with us to measurably improve the state of healthcare globally.

Frontend Hypewords: Vue.js/Vuex/Vuetify, Webpack (for our reference impl. but we use other PWA stacks too - React is next up now that it's under MIT)

Systems Hypewords: AWS (multi-region deployments), Ansible, Beanstalk, Docker, Aurora, HIPAA/PCI Compliance

Front End Web Developer: https://healthprize.com/careers-page/#op-206457-front-end-we....

Lead Systems Engineer: https://healthprize.com/careers-page/#op-208838-lead-systems....

items.title: Senior Redshift Engineer @ Clevertech
items.content:
Senior Redshift Engineer @ Clevertech

2017-11-24 16:38

Description

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Senior AWS Redshift Engineer to join our global team. We are looking for team members to help us develop world class software products for the most exclusive organizations in the world. We have been at this since 2000, and continue to grow off our best asset, our people.

You are comfortable translating functional and technical requirements into detailed architecture and design in addition to overall system architecture, scalability, reliability, and performance. You are highly experienced with large-scale data analytics and data warehousing. You are able to devise proactive solutions to project-related issues and have stellar communication skills to be able to effectively communicate and inspire trust in all stakeholders.

We will only consider candidates who have worked with petabytes of data in Redshift.

REQUIREMENTS

Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code. You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like minded individuals.

Technically, you have an excellent background with large-scale data structures,highly scalable server architectures and experience with network load balancers and network security. Familiarity with large scale distributed server infrastructure design and development is essential in addition to being comfortable with industry best practices.

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Seeq Corporation: Dev Ops / Historian Admin
items.content:
Dev Ops / Historian Admin

Posted Nov 7

Seeq Corporation
Headquarters: Virtual/Remote, USA
https://seeq.com

Seeq is a data analytics startup. What makes us different is that weâ€™re going after a big market thatâ€™s often overlooked by tech companies: industrial process data. Think pharmaceutical manufacturers, wind farms, and energy companies with tons of equipment and sensors. Weâ€™re applying a unique mix of technologies and a deep understanding of the problems faced by these industries to build and refine a product that's a huge leap over existing tools and methodologies.

Our company is 100% remote. You can work anywhere in the US (we're staying in compatible timezones for now). We use a variety of collaboration tools, like Zoom and Slack, which makes us feel like weâ€™re in the same building together. We have a stacked team of kind-hearted, talented engineers that love to collaborate, teach each other new tricks, and build products that far exceed our customersâ€™ expectations.

Seeq needs an information technology rockstar with experience and knowledge of networks, databases and plant historians (OPC experience is a big plus). This position will work closely with the Seeq Analytics Engineering team on installing and configuring Seeq software and historians. Connectivity requires working through network topologies, firewalls, and authentication issues.
Skills & Requirements:

  • You like to work closely with customers, solve their problems and make them happy.
  • You are a natural when it comes to troubleshooting network issues, authentication problems, and operating system idiosyncrasies.
  • You already know or are excited to learn about cloud platforms like Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform.
  • You wield command line tools for Bash and Powershell like swords, and you know or are excited to learn about programming languages like Python, Java, and Javascript.
  • Experience with or excited to learn how to use tools like Wireshark and Fiddler for debugging connections.
  • Youâ€™re disciplined with a high attention to detail. You are constantly finding ways to perfect your craft, be a better teammate, and come up with cool stuff.
  • You love to learn, and you learn things quickly. Youâ€™re usually the one suggesting new technologies and raising the bar for the whole team. You listen really well, and you know how to make your ideas be heard without turning people off.
  • You have a degree in Computer Science or Engineering.
  • You are up for traveling periodically to hang out with your colleagues and get some face-to-face time.
  • You know how to balance life & work, and you donâ€™t want a job that forces you to choose between them.
  • You want to work with a bunch of really smart people that love working together. And you want to work for a startup with good investors and a bright future.

The ideal candidate would likely have some background in one or more of the following systems:

  • OPC Historical Data Access
  • OSIsoft PI Data Archive, Wonderware, GE Proficy
  • MySQL
  • Oracle
  • MSFT SQL Server
  • PostgreSQL
  • Inductive Ignition

Apply for this position

Please submit your cover letter and resume here: https://seeq.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0fv4h

items.title: DevOps Architect at Oracle UK (London, UK) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: DevOps, System Administrator
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Enterprise Software
Company size: 10k+ people
Company type: Public

Job description

One of Oracleâ€™s most elite teams, the Product Development Cloud Solution Architects Team (the A-Team), is seeking a DevOps Architect to help strategic customers around the world succeed, implement best practices, provide real world feedback to Product Engineering and Product Management teams, and evangelize Oracle services and products through conferences and blog posts. This is a senior position with high visibility within the company.

You will join an experienced and international team, distributed in over 10 countries. You may work from home, or any Oracle office of your choice. We value and practice daily transparency, supportive feedback loops and direct communication. Team cohesion and helping each other is the core of our nature.

Applications involve the latest technologies, such as Mobile, AR/VR, Intelligent Bots. The team moves as new technologies come up, great career opportunities.

About 50% of the work is coming from the Oracle Executive Technology team, 50% is self-directed and relies on a high sense of initiative from team members to develop the business or investigate new technology trends.

 Desired Skills:

   - Expert-level, real world, experience in CI/CD, unit testing, Docker and Kubernetes

   - Hands-on experience with different Cloud vendors on large-scale deployments

   - Excellent programming skills in Java, Node and/or other relvent languages

   - Strong Agile background (eg. SCRUM/Kanban), able to practice and mentor others

   - Experience with designing large-scale, fault-tolerant distributed systems

   - Ability to quickly create POC and prototypes, including web/mobile front-ends

   - Comfortable with building his/her network within the organization with peers, engage in executive-level communication and handle direct customer interactions

   - Experienced at leading technical teams through discovery, planning, implementation and risk remediation

   - Open-source contribution and public speaking a plus

   - Comfortable working in a distributed team through Slack, emails, conf call; 5-10 days travel per quarter expected

   - 10-20 years of software industry experience is expected

Key highlights:

  - work from home option

  - high-profile team, reporting directly into CTO

  - all the latest tech: Docker, k8, AR/VR, Intelligent Bots

About Oracle UK

With more than 420,000 customers and deployments in more than 145 countries, Oracle offers a comprehensive and fully integrated stack of cloud applications, platform services, and engineered systems.

Benefits

Cycle Scheme
Your Wellbeing, Your Choice Benefits Fund
Access to Car Ownership Scheme
Excellent Learning Opportunities
Childcare Vouchers & Workplace Nursery
Discount Dining Cards
Financial awareness programme and workshops
Pension
Medical coverage
Life Assurance

items.title: Node.js / MySQL developer at Vimbly (New York, NY) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Recreation & Leisure, Software Development / Engineering, Web Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Why join Vimbly?

Vimbly Technologies is a funded and profitable web 2.0 startup looking for a highly motivated, hard-hitting Node.js developer to join the team.  Vimbly Technologies is a fast-paced company focused on creating custom best-in-class, high-performance solutions for enterprises spanning a variety of industries.  At Vimbly, youâ€™ll work side-by-side with proven talent, creative intelligence, and smiley faces (with firm but non-painful handshakes) -- out of our office in the best city in the world, right across from the Empire State Building. Your work will have a direct and meaningful impact on the product. We aren't looking for another cog in the wheel. You will be given significant responsibility and independence. You will be challenged.

Node.js Developer

We are looking for a Node.js developer with a burning curiosity, passion for building great products, track record of writing maintainable code, and reputation of being reliable and efficient.

Candidates able to join our team on-site in our office in Midtown Manhattan are highly preferred, but consideration for remote work will be given to exceptional candidates.  Please indicate your location on your application; applications without location will be ignored.

Responsibilities

  • Work directly with leadership on implementing cutting-edge company initiatives
  • Develop scalable and robust back-end systems (e.g., payment, analytics, scheduling)
  • Work with front-end team to integrate user-facing markup into systems
  • Take ownership of multiple projects and learn new technologies over time

Benefits

  • 100% employer-covered health, dental & vision insurance
  • Unlimited vacation days (just get your work done)
  • Activity budget to try items on Vimbly -- try one, try them all!
  • Personal movie outings (you'll get more pairs of movie tickets than you're able to use -- so you'll know the contrast from a Vimbly activity!)
  • Unlimited Amazon reading budget to buy any book you please
  • Monthly social outings (Laser tag and paintball? Coming right up...)
  • Monthly massage and optional monthly manicureâ€¦ except they come to you

Skills & Requirements

Requirements

  • Expert-level experience with Node.js and MySQL
  • Deep understanding of Node promises and event loop
  • Basic understanding of front-end development and implementation (HTML5, CSS3, and jQuery)
  • Knowledge of Git version control
  • Exemplary attention to detail
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or equivalent

Optional Bonus Points

  • Basic knowledge of system administration in Linux and Apache
  • Experience with Angular 2.x / 4.x
  • Experience working with large datasets
  • Experience with process efficiency optimization

About Vimbly

Founded in 2011, Vimbly is a funded web 2.0 startup that lets users find and book recreational activities for free. Our mission is to eliminate hours of research for thousands of activities like tango lessons, intro photography classes, or Italian cooking sessions. All the information is in one place instead of the usual process of Googling, picking nearby locations, checking prices, manually comparing schedules (which are each presented differently), and then exchanging emails to lock it down.

The Vimbly team is a diverse, smart and energetic group of problem solvers.  We are each experts in our specific trade, unified by a passion to build a great product that will change the way people discover activities, date ideas, things to do, and life experiences.

Benefits

Health / dental / vision insurance
Activity budget to try items on Vimbly
Unlimited vacation days (just get your work done)
Monthly massage and optional monthly manicure... and they come to you
Monthly social outings (laser tag and paintball? Coming right up...)

items.title: Redshift DBA Remote - Bigdata Dimension Inc - Remote
items.content:
Redshift DBA Remote
Bigdata Dimension Inc -Remote

Role: AWS Redshift DBA/Architect

US Bachelors is must

Position Description ( 7-10 years of experience) The AWS Redshift DBA/Architect will be responsible for analyzing requirements, prototyping data analysis solutions (primarily in Redshift) , collecting, preparing data for modeling on AWS, create new clusters, proficient in Redshift, specifically database & platform tuning and optimization. Extensive knowledge in configuring Redshift Query Queueâ€™s and ability to capture & interpret database resource utilization both at the database and platform levels. Have expereince or exposure with administration of VM System for Marketing Analytics.

Candidates need to have strong capabilities in large data warehouses using relational and/or Hadoop based systems., UNIX scripting

Required Skills:

  • Must have extensive experience with data implementations, data storage and distribution
  • Data modeling logical and physical
  • Proficient in Redshift, specifically database & platform tuning and optimization. Extensive knowledge in configuring Redshift Query Queueâ€™s and ability to capture & interpret database resource utilization both at the database and platform levels.
  • Optimization and tuning of data structures and queries on Big Data platforms on AWS
  • Data Analysis and data profiling
  • Unix / Shell scripting
  • Oracle database SQL skills
  • Programming experience Java or Scala
  • Excellent Problem Solving and Debugging skills
  • Strong agile development experience
  • Test and maintain applications and test frameworks

Preferred Skills:

  • Understanding of statistics and machine learning
  • Understanding of predictive models
  • Experience interfacing with big data analytics applications like Tableau or analytic stacks like Shark/Spark, or Impala

Education: - Bachelorâ€™s degree in computer science , statistics or related field- Good Communication Skills

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • US Bachelors: 1 year
  • AWS Cluster Development: 1 year
  • Database Tuning: 1 year
  • Redshift DBA: 1 year

Required language:

  • English
